title: Testing Chat GPT Book Recommendations
text:
Introduction
I am trying to broaden the types of books I read as well as get back into reading. I have consistently stuck to the same author (Colleen Hoover) and want to find more books in that vein but a different author.
Prompt
I need help finding book recommendations. I have read a lot of Colleen Hoover books but want to switch to a different author. I want something that is a light fun read, not to say it is has to be happy and fun, but something that gets you hooked and is a great story line. Knowing that information can you give me some recommendations
Response
Authors & Books to Try
Emily Henry
People We Meet on Vacation ‚Äî sweet friends-to-lovers setup, great dialogue, heartfelt but still fun. Wikipedia
If you like her style, Beach Read is another good one. (Rom-com but with emotional depth.)
Talia Hibbert
Get a Life, Chloe Brown ‚Äî charming, warm, good banter, strong character growth. Wikipedia
Josie Silver
If you want something with emotional punch but also a comforting storyline, The Two Lives of Lydia Bird is often recommended. Never Enough Novels
Ali Hazelwood
If you like romance with humor and modern settings, her The Love Hypothesis has gotten lots of praise. Khristina Chess
Ana Huang, Lucy Score, Meghan Quinn
These are more spicy, more heat, but great storytelling that some CoHo fans love. Reddit +1
Kathleen Center / Kristy Woodson Harvey
For heartwarming, relation-focused stories with emotional arcs. These tend to be lighter but satisfying. Facebook +1
If you want, I can pull up 3-5 specific book titles right now that match exactly the tone you want (lighter, romantic, maybe funny). Do you prefer more romance/comedy vs drama/heavy emotion?
You said: I prefer more drama/heavy emotion ChatGPT said:
If you want books with heavier emotional stakes ‚Äî stories that tug on your heart, maybe make you think, maybe make you cry ‚Äî here are several suggestions. Some are very close to the feel of Colleen Hoover-ish drama, others are a bit different but still powerful.
üìö Book / Author Recommendations
Me Before You by Jojo Moyes
Louisa is hired to care for Will Traynor, who is paralyzed after an accident. Their relationship develops in unexpected ways. It deals with themes of loss, love, autonomy, and whether life is always worth living when everything changes. Medium +3 The Guardian +3 Wikipedia +3
Taylor Jenkins Reid ‚Äì her works tend to have rich characters, secrets, and emotional complexity. Some picks in particular:
The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo ‚Äî a starlet‚Äôs life, multiple marriages, secrets, what you give up for fame and love. Beyond the Bookends +2 She Reads +2
One True Loves ‚Äî torn between a past presumed dead and a new love; it‚Äôs about grief, identity, and choice. She Reads +1
Forever, Interrupted ‚Äî sudden tragedy early in a relationship and how the character copes. She Reads +1
Helen Hoang
The Heart Principle ‚Äî it has heavier emotional content than just a romance, delves into personal trauma, expectations, how past wounds affect love. Wikipedia
The Bride Test ‚Äî also emotional; culture, family expectations, being vulnerable emotionally. Wikipedia
Grief & Realism in Relationships
Nothing Burns as Bright as You by Ashley Woodfolk ‚Äî lots of complicated feelings, grief, messy relationships. Epic Reads
Classic & Tearjerker Titles
The Fault in Our Stars by John Green ‚Äî you likely know this, but it hits hard. Illness, love, existential questions. TCK Publishing +1
Nights in Rodanthe by Nicholas Sparks ‚Äî love in difficult circumstances, sacrifice, emotional resonance. Wikipedia
Conclusion
I was extremely happy with this response and honestly cannot believe I didn‚Äôt consult AI sooner! Most of these books I have not read but I looked them up and they seem totally up my alley! The first one suggested is the only one I have read and it is by my second favorite author, which makes me very hopeful about the rest of the suggestions. What I am going to do next is read these books and then give Chat GPT my reviews and specific thoughts to see how that will fine tune their suggestions and recommendations for me.

title: Cocktail Recipe
text:
Introduction
I am hosting a dinner party tonight and would like to see if Chat GPT can help me come up with a good cocktail that is unique and tasty to serve for a big group.
Prompt
I am hosting a dinner party tonight for around 20 people. It is a calm dinner with friends of mine and I want to think of a good cocktail that is universal enough to serve for a large group of people that most likely everyone will enjoy - not overwhelmingly sweet or bitter, but a classic cocktail. I do not want a standard cocktail like a margarita but something unique. Can you help me come up with something?
Response
ü•Ç Option 1 ‚Äî French 75 Punch
Profile: Light, crisp, bubbly, citrusy ‚Äî a celebratory crowd-pleaser Why it works: Universally appealing, refreshing, and festive without being sugary
Ingredients (for ~20 servings):
2 cups gin (London Dry like Tanqueray or Beefeater)
1¬Ω cups fresh lemon juice
1¬Ω cups simple syrup (1:1 sugar and water)
2 bottles chilled dry sparkling wine (like brut Champagne or cava)
Lemon wheels and sprigs of thyme for garnish
Instructions:
Chill all ingredients.
In a punch bowl, mix gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup with ice.
Just before serving, top with sparkling wine.
Garnish with lemon wheels and thyme.
Pro tip: Serve in coupe or flute glasses. Very elegant and easy to make ahead.
üçä Option 2 ‚Äî White Negroni Spritz
Profile: Bright, aromatic, slightly herbal ‚Äî more interesting than a standard spritz Why it works: Sophisticated but not bitter like a classic Negroni
Ingredients (for ~20 servings):
2 cups gin
2 cups Lillet Blanc (or Cocchi Americano)
1¬Ω cups Suze (gentian liqueur ‚Äî lightly bitter)
2 bottles prosecco or sparkling water (depending on strength preference)
Orange slices for garnish
Instructions:
Mix gin, Lillet, and Suze with ice in a pitcher or punch bowl.
Chill thoroughly.
Just before serving, top with prosecco (for a boozy spritz) or sparkling water (for lower-ABV).
Garnish with orange slices.
Pro tip: This looks beautiful served over ice in large wine glasses.
üçë Option 3 ‚Äî Peach Bourbon Smash (Lightened)
Profile: Fruity yet balanced, slightly herbal ‚Äî crowd-pleaser for whiskey skeptics Why it works: Approachable and unexpected; feels seasonal and cozy
Ingredients (for ~20 servings):
3 cups bourbon
2 cups peach pur√©e or nectar
1 cup fresh lemon juice
1 cup simple syrup
Handful of fresh mint leaves
Club soda (about 3‚Äì4 cups) to top
Instructions:
Muddle mint lightly in a punch bowl.
Add bourbon, peach, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Stir with ice and chill.
Top with soda just before serving.
Garnish with mint sprigs and peach slices.
Pro tip: If peach isn‚Äôt in season, frozen slices or high-quality nectar work great.
Conclusion
I ended up making and trying each of these drinks with a few of my friends prior to the party, and ended up serving the French 75 and White Negroni spritz. These were well balanced drinks and great for a dinner party - and definitely much better than something I would have come up with!

title: GPT & History
text:
Introduction
I have had many instances where Chat GPT has been wrong, of course, usually mathematically, but I was curious if Chat GPT would go so far as to create events that never happened, if my context suggested that they did. In this example, I will be trying to hint at Chat GPT and try to ‚Äútrick‚Äù it to see if it confidently gives me an event in history that never happened. For example, the Battle of Atres is a made up battle but I am going to frame it in the context that I give GPT which makes it seem like it happened and see how it responds.
Prompt
I am studying for my history class and need help gathering additional information. Will you please give me information on the Battle of Atres that occurred after Operation Uranus when The Red Army launches a massive counteroffensive against Germany and Germany fights back. Please give me some preliminary information on the Battle of Atres
Response
I can‚Äôt find any World War II battle called ‚ÄúAtres.‚Äù Given your description (‚Äúafter Operation Uranus, the Red Army launches a massive counteroffensive and Germany fights back‚Äù), you‚Äôre almost certainly thinking of the winter 1942‚Äì43 sequence around Stalingrad and Kharkiv‚Äîin particular: the failed German relief attempt Operation Winter Storm (Dec 12‚Äì23, 1942), the Soviet follow-on Operation Little Saturn (Dec 16‚Äì30, 1942), and then the German ‚Äúbackhand blow‚Äù culminating in the Third Battle of Kharkov (Feb 19‚ÄìMar 15, 1943). Here‚Äôs preliminary info you can use:
Operation Uranus (Nov 19‚Äì23, 1942) encircled Germany‚Äôs 6th Army at Stalingrad, trapping ~250‚Äì300k Axis troops. This set the stage for everything that followed. Wikipedia +1
Operation Winter Storm was Germany‚Äôs counter to ‚Äúbreak the ring‚Äù from the southwest using 4th Panzer Army under Manstein/Hoth. It advanced ~50‚Äì60 km but stalled; the encirclement held. Outcome: Soviet victory; Stalingrad remained sealed. Dates: Dec 12‚Äì23, 1942. Wikipedia
Operation Little Saturn was the Red Army‚Äôs broader riposte, smashing Axis allies on the Don and Chir and threatening to cut off Army Group A in the Caucasus. Outcome: Soviet victory; German southern front destabilized. Dates: Dec 16‚Äì30, 1942. Wikipedia
Riding post-Stalingrad momentum, the Soviets launched Operation Gallop (Jan 29‚ÄìFeb 18, 1943) toward the Donbas/Sea of Azov and Operation Star (Feb 2‚ÄìMar 3, 1943) aimed at Kharkov and Kursk. They initially liberated Kharkov and Belgorod but overextended and outran logistics. Wikipedia +2 Wikipedia +2
Germany ‚Äúfights back‚Äù: Third Battle of Kharkov. Manstein regrouped Army Group South and counterattacked with 4th Panzer Army and the II SS Panzer Corps, exploiting thin Soviet salients. Result: German victory‚Äîthey retook Kharkov (mid-March 1943) and stabilized the line along the Donets, setting conditions for the summer showdown at Kursk. Dates: Feb 19‚ÄìMar 15, 1943. Wikipedia
If your instructor really did mean a battle named ‚ÄúAtres,‚Äù it may be a mix-up with Arras (a different battle and in 1940, not related to Stalingrad). But for your class notes, the above chain‚ÄîWinter Storm ‚Üí Little Saturn ‚Üí Gallop/Star ‚Üí Third Kharkov‚Äîis the standard ‚ÄúRed Army counteroffensive and German counter-counteroffensive‚Äù after Uranus. Wikipedia
Want me to turn this into a one-page study sheet (dates, commanders, objectives, outcomes, why it mattered)?
Conclusion
In conclusion, I am very happily suprised that Chat GPT caught my error, as in the past I know people have had different experiences where Chat GPT has created false information. I had tried to trick Chat GPT by ‚Äúsandwiching‚Äù this made up battle in between accurate information to see if it would not register, but it did. I also noticed it took longer for Chat GPT to deliver a response, as it likely was struggling to find information on this made up battle.

title: Daily News
text:
Introduction
I am trying to be better at being up to date with current world news, but sometimes I do not have time to check every app that I frequently check every morning or throughout the day. The news outlets I typically check and have downloaded on my phone are The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Wall Street Journal, BBC News and The Guardian. I also like to check the Middle Eastern sections of these sources (where applicable) to stay informed on the relevant dynamics and events occuring in the Middle East. I am going to tell Chat GPT this information and see if they can give me a good daily overview/summary to gather key points that I would have found in those news outlets.
Prompt
I want you to give me a good overview of the daily news gathered from reputable news sources, and specifically based on the news outlets I usually check. My most frequently used are The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Wall Street Journal, BBC News and The Guardian. I also like to read and be informed on the Middle Eastern sections to see current news in Middle Eastern policy and politics. Please give me an up to date overview for my daily news intake
Response
Here‚Äôs a round-up of what‚Äôs happening now, especially in U.S./Western politics and the Middle East / regional policy. If you want, I can pull together full article summaries from NYT, WaPo, WSJ etc. too.
Key U.S. / Western-Politics Stories
Charlie Kirk Killing & Manhunt Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was shot and killed at a university event in Utah. Law enforcement is actively searching for a suspect. Al Jazeera +2 The Independent +2
Rubio to Visit Israel Amid Tensions Secretary of State Marco Rubio is set to travel to Israel shortly after an Israeli airstrike in Doha, Qatar, targeting Hamas leaders. The trip is meant to reinforce U.S. commitments to Israel‚Äôs security, discussions on hostages in Gaza, and address worries among U.S. allies about regional stability. Reuters +1
U.S. Political Reactions to Israeli Airstrike in Qatar The airstrike has disturbed diplomacy. Critics in the U.S. argue it disrupted ceasefire negotiations, raised questions about American complicity or awareness, and stirred concern among Gulf states over U.S. reliability as an ally. The Washington Post +3 The Washington Post +3 The Washington Post +3
Senators Accuse Israel of Ethnic Cleansing, U.S. Complicity A report by Democratic Senators ‚Äî after visits to affected zones ‚Äî claims that the destruction in Gaza, restrictions on humanitarian aid, and forced displacement amount to ethnic cleansing. They call on the U.S. to reconsider its military and political support. The Guardian
Middle East / Regional Policy & Conflict
Israeli Airstrike in Qatar Israel carried out an airstrike in Doha targeting Hamas leaders who were reportedly in discussions related to a proposed ceasefire and hostage exchange. The strike killed several people, including a Qatari security officer, and injured others. The event has caused diplomatic fallout, particularly between Qatar and Israel, and raised questions about sovereignty, mediation, and negotiation. The Washington Post +4 Reuters +4 The Washington Post +4
Gulf States Question U.S. Protection / Regional Security Gulf nations are increasingly uneasy about the U.S. as a guarantor of their security. The Qatar strike, especially given U.S. military presence there, has heightened concerns that Israel may act without sufficient U.S. restraint or consultation, potentially destabilizing regional alliances. The Washington Post +1
Humanitarian & Ceasefire Pressures There is growing pressure ‚Äî domestic, regional, and international ‚Äî for ceasefire negotiations in Gaza to resume. The strike in Qatar is seen by many as undermining those talks. Meanwhile, the humanitarian crisis in Gaza is worsening, with serious concerns about aid blockages. The Washington Post +2 The Guardian +2
Implications & What to Watch
Diplomatic Fallout: The strike in Doha is likely to strain Israel‚Äôs relationship with Qatar and other Gulf states, which may feel their role as mediators is compromised. U.S. diplomacy will be tested: managing its alliances, public opinion, and responsibilities in the region.
Negotiation Viability: If key actors believe that negotiation efforts can be undercut by military strikes, trust deteriorates. This might reduce incentives for Hamas or other groups to compromise‚Äîor for mediators to broker deals.
U.S. Domestic Debate: The senators‚Äô report and the concerns about U.S. foreign policy (whether in supporting Israel or in managing diplomatic fallout) signal possible shifts in how Congress and the public view the U.S.‚Äôs role in the Gaza conflict.
Regional Security Realignments: Gulf states may reconsider their security strategies if they feel exposed. Potential outcomes include deeper regional cooperation independent of the U.S., or more hedging.
Conclusion
Based on my general knowledge of current news and a brief look through some of the outlets mentioned above, Chat GPT seems to have captured a lot of the main and most important events. In my opinion, this is a pretty great overview and very helpful to stay informed especially without enough time to properly read through articles and news outlets.

title: How Well Can Chat GPT Act as a Doctor?
text:
Introduction
As someone who worrries a bit about health but sometimes wants information on little sicknesses or mishaps here and there without needing to go to the doctor, I wanted to test chat GPT‚Äôs abilities to help me recover from a stomach bug. I didn‚Äôt just want a summary of to do and to not do‚Äôs but an interactive experience where I could ask continuous quesetions building upon the knowledge I fed it.
Prompt
‚ÄúI have a bit of an upset stomach and believe I have a stomach bug. What medications should I take and avoid and what should I be eating? How many saltines can I eat‚Äù
Medications (over-the-counter)
Bismuth subsalicylate (Pepto-Bismol, Kaopectate): Can help with both stomach upset and sometimes nausea.
Oral rehydration solutions (like Pedialyte or electrolyte packets): Important if diarrhea is frequent, to avoid dehydration.
What to Eat (the ‚ÄúBRAT‚Äù diet is commonly recommended)
Bananas
Rice (plain white rice)
Applesauce
Toast
Other gentle foods: plain crackers (like saltines), oatmeal, boiled potatoes, or plain chicken. Avoid greasy, spicy, high-fat, or very sugary foods until you feel better.
About Saltines
Yes, you can eat saltines. A whole pack might be a bit much at once‚Äîsometimes too much starch/salt can make you feel more bloated or uncomfortable. It‚Äôs better to eat a few at a time throughout the day, with fluids, instead of all at once.
Fluids
Sip water, diluted juice, or electrolyte drinks slowly.
Avoid alcohol, caffeine, and very sugary drinks (can worsen diarrhea).
Do you want me to also give you a sample ‚Äúwhat to eat today‚Äù plan that‚Äôs easy on your stomach?
üåÖ Morning
Breakfast:
A slice or two of plain toast (dry or with just a little bit of jam or honey).
A banana (easy to digest, provides potassium).
Sip warm water or weak tea (like chamomile or peppermint).
‚òÄÔ∏è Midday
Lunch:
Plain white rice or oatmeal cooked with water.
Optional: a little bit of plain applesauce.
Drink water or electrolyte solution slowly.
üåá Afternoon Snack
A few saltine crackers (not the whole pack at once, but you can spread them out through the day).
Small sips of ginger ale (flat, without bubbles) or herbal tea if nausea is present.
üåô Evening
Dinner:
Boiled or baked skinless chicken (very small portion, plain).
Boiled potatoes (no butter/cream, just plain).
Steamed carrots or zucchini (soft and plain, if tolerated).
Before Bed
A few more crackers or toast if you feel hungry.
Sip water or Pedialyte to stay hydrated overnight.
‚ö†Ô∏è Avoid today: dairy (milk, cheese, ice cream), coffee, alcohol, spicy food, fried/greasy food, and raw vegetables.
Would you like me to also make you a 2‚Äì3 day progression plan (how to move from ‚Äúonly bland‚Äù back to normal foods safely)?
Throughout the next few days I would return to this chat, asking follow up ‚Äúcan I do this or that‚Äù questions, and would make sure to consult Chat GPT before consuming anything new. For example, I asked if I could eat pasta, and inserted a picture of the certain pasta I wanted to eat including the ingrediants - and this was the response.
Great job checking the label ‚Äî this Barilla Penne (blue box) is regular pasta made from semolina/durum wheat flour, not whole wheat. üëç
You can see in the ingredients list:
Semolina (wheat), durum wheat flour ‚Üí this is refined white flour.
If it were whole wheat, it would clearly say ‚Äúwhole wheat flour‚Äù and the pasta would look darker brown.
So yes ‚Äî this is the type that‚Äôs gentler on your stomach compared to whole wheat right now.
üëâ Just cook it plain, keep the portion small, and avoid heavy sauces. A little olive oil, or just eat it plain with some broth, would be easiest on your stomach.
Would you like me to suggest a simple ‚Äústomach-friendly pasta recipe‚Äù you could make with this box?
üåø Stomach-Friendly Plain Pasta Recipe
Ingredients
1 cup Barilla penne pasta (uncooked)
4 cups water
¬Ω teaspoon salt (optional, or just a pinch)
1‚Äì2 teaspoons olive oil (optional, just for a little moisture)
(Optional, if you‚Äôre ready for protein) a few bites of plain boiled chicken or soft scrambled egg
Instructions
Bring the water to a boil.
Add the pasta (and salt if using). Cook until very soft (slightly longer than al dente ‚Äî easier to digest).
Drain and rinse lightly with warm water.
Return to the pot and drizzle with a tiny bit of olive oil, or leave plain.
Serve warm.
Conclusion
I followed steps, recipes, and instructions like these throughout the week, solely using Chat GPT‚Äôs consultation to direct my actions, and definitely saw a result. Everything it advised me was correct and my stomach bug slowly subsided as I had Chat GPT help me reintroduce ‚Äúnormal‚Äù foods back into my diet. I find Chat GPT very helpful and an incredible resources for illnesses that aren‚Äôt severe or remotely health threatening. Especially when I have constant small follow up questions that aren‚Äôt necessary to consult with a doctor to ask, AI can be incredibly useful and I had a great experience, as I usually do when consulting GPT over health related issues.

title: Beginner Recipes
text:
Introduction
I am recently learning how to cook but am having trouble coming up with recipes. I am curious by Chat GPT‚Äôs ability to come up with more creative but easy recipes.
Prompt
I am recently learning how to cook but have been making the same thing since I cannot think of new staple recipes: chicken and pasta. Can you help me come up with some good recipes that are staple dinner items not too complicated but not too simple?
Response
Got it ‚Äî you want to build out a little rotation of staple dinners: not just chicken and pasta, but a handful of easy-to-repeat recipes that are flavorful, not intimidating, and versatile enough to become go-tos. I‚Äôll break this down into categories with examples you can pick from.

Proteins Beyond Chicken

Salmon with Lemon & Dill (Sheet Pan Style) Season salmon with olive oil, lemon, salt, and dill. Roast on a sheet pan alongside asparagus or broccoli for 15 minutes.
Beef Stir-Fry Thinly slice beef, saut√© with garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and mixed veggies. Serve over rice or noodles.
Turkey or Beef Chili Brown ground turkey or beef, add canned beans, tomatoes, chili powder, and simmer. Tastes better the next day too.

Vegetarian Staples

Shakshuka (Eggs in Tomato Sauce) Saut√© onions, peppers, and garlic, add canned tomatoes + spices, simmer, then crack eggs into the sauce and cook until set.
Lentil Soup Saut√© onion, carrot, celery, add garlic, lentils, broth, and spices. Finish with lemon juice.
Vegetable Curry Simmer chickpeas or lentils with coconut milk, curry paste/powder, and veggies. Serve with rice or naan.

One-Pot or Sheet Pan Dinners

Shrimp Fried Rice Use leftover rice, scramble in an egg, toss in shrimp, frozen peas, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
Sausage & Veggie Sheet Pan Bake Slice chicken sausage, potatoes, and peppers, drizzle with olive oil and spices, and roast until golden.
Risotto (Easy Style) Arborio rice cooked slowly with broth, onions, and parmesan. Can add mushrooms or shrimp for variety.

Lighter Options

Greek Bowls Base of rice or quinoa, topped with grilled chicken/lamb, cucumber, tomato, red onion, and tzatziki.
Stuffed Sweet Potatoes Roast sweet potatoes, then stuff with black beans, avocado, and salsa (Tex-Mex style) or spinach & feta (Mediterranean).
Salmon or Tuna Poke Bowl Rice, cubed raw (or seared) fish, soy-sesame dressing, avocado, and cucumber.

‚ÄúUpgrade Your Pasta‚Äù

Since you‚Äôre already doing chicken + pasta, here are a few twists:
Cacio e Pepe (buttery, peppery cheese pasta‚Äî3 ingredients, feels fancy).
Bolognese (ground beef/turkey slow cooked with tomato and onion).
Pasta Primavera (lots of saut√©ed seasonal veggies, olive oil, garlic, parmesan).
üëâ Here‚Äôs a tip: pick 5 recipes across these categories and put them on rotation for the next month. Once they feel easy, swap in new ones so you always have variety without needing to think too hard.
Would you like me to make you a sample 1-week dinner plan with shopping list (based on these staples), so it‚Äôs plug-and-play?
I then responded yes and requested the 1 week dinner plan to try out.
Response 2
Perfect! I‚Äôll give you a 1-week dinner plan that mixes proteins, veggies, and grains so it feels balanced ‚Äî and I‚Äôll include a shopping list at the end so you don‚Äôt have to think twice.
üóìÔ∏è 1-Week Dinner Plan Day 1 ‚Äì Monday
Salmon with Lemon & Dill (Sheet Pan)
Salmon fillets, lemon, dill, olive oil.
Roast with asparagus + baby potatoes.
Day 2 ‚Äì Tuesday
Turkey Chili
Ground turkey, canned beans, tomatoes, onion, chili powder.
Serve with rice, tortilla chips, or a dollop of Greek yogurt.
Day 3 ‚Äì Wednesday
Shakshuka (Eggs in Tomato Sauce)
Peppers, onion, garlic, canned tomatoes, paprika, cumin.
Crack eggs on top, simmer until cooked.
Serve with crusty bread or pita.
Day 4 ‚Äì Thursday
Shrimp Fried Rice
Leftover rice (best if cold), shrimp, egg, frozen peas, soy sauce, sesame oil.
Quick stir-fry in one pan.
Day 5 ‚Äì Friday
Greek Bowls
Quinoa or rice base, grilled chicken, cucumber, tomato, red onion.
Topped with tzatziki or hummus.
Day 6 ‚Äì Saturday
Vegetable Curry
Chickpeas or lentils, coconut milk, curry paste/powder.
Add spinach, carrots, or cauliflower.
Serve with rice or naan.
Day 7 ‚Äì Sunday
Sausage & Veggie Sheet Pan Bake
Chicken sausage, bell peppers, onions, zucchini, potatoes.
Toss with olive oil + Italian herbs, roast until golden.
üõí Shopping List Proteins
Salmon fillets (2‚Äì3)
Ground turkey (1 lb)
Shrimp (1 lb, peeled & deveined)
Chicken breast (2‚Äì3)
Chicken sausage (4 links)
Eggs (1 dozen)
Canned/Dry
Canned chickpeas (2)
Lentils (dry or canned, 1 pack)
Canned diced tomatoes (3)
Tomato paste (1 small can)
Kidney or black beans (2 cans)
Rice (jasmine or basmati, 2 cups)
Quinoa (1 cup)
Vegetables
Bell peppers (4)
Onion (2 yellow, 1 red)
Garlic (1 bulb)
Asparagus (1 bunch)
Baby potatoes (1 bag)
Zucchini (2)
Carrots (3‚Äì4)
Spinach (1 bag)
Cauliflower (optional for curry)
Pantry/Fridge Extras
Olive oil
Soy sauce
Sesame oil
Curry powder or paste
Chili powder
Paprika, cumin, oregano, dill (dried or fresh)
Greek yogurt or tzatziki
Naan or pita (optional)
Toppings/Flavor
Lemon (2)
Fresh dill (optional, can sub dried)
Feta cheese (optional, for Greek bowls)
‚úÖ With this list, you‚Äôll have enough to cover all 7 meals (with some leftovers for lunch too). ‚úÖ Most of these recipes take 30‚Äì40 minutes max, some even less. ‚úÖ You can mix and match ‚Äî e.g., swap chicken into the curry or use the chili beans in a salad.
Do you want me to also give you a meal-prep flow (like what to prep on Sunday to make weekdays even faster), or do you prefer to cook everything fresh each night?
Conclusion
I think Chat GPT did a pretty good job of coming up with beginner recipes. I think there could have been more specifics and it was a bit general with instructions; however, I did find this useful and although I did not follow the full one week plan I made a few of the recipes and it was great.
